headline: Should Mondelez Arabia Leadership Shift Under Ziad Abla Shape MDLZ’s Local First Strategy in Saudi Arabia?
summary: Mondelez International recently appointed long-time executive Ziad Abla as Managing Director for Mondelez Arabia, tasking him with leading the Saudi business, expanding categories, deepening partnerships, and enhancing supply chain performance in alignment with Saudi Arabia’s Vision 2030. By elevating a regional veteran to oversee a key growth market and local talent development, Mondelez is tightening the link between its "Local First" strategy and Saudi Arabia’s economic and social...

headline: Is Mondelez (MDLZ) Priced Attractive After Mixed Returns And DCF Earnings Signals?
summary: If you are wondering whether Mondelez International is reasonably priced or quietly mispriced, you are not alone. This article is built to help you frame that question clearly. Over the past week the stock has returned 4.7%, with returns of 5.3% over 30 days, 14.8% year to date, 1.6% over 3 years and 25.6% over 5 years, while the 1-year return sits at a 1.1% decline. This gives a mixed backdrop for anyone thinking about value today. Recent coverage around Mondelez has focused on its position...

headline: A Look At Mondelez International (MDLZ) Valuation After Recent Share Price Strength
summary: Mondelez International (MDLZ) has drawn fresh attention after a recent share move, with the stock last closing at US$61.58. Investors are weighing that price against the company’s profitability and global snack portfolio. See our latest analysis for Mondelez International. That latest move fits into a stronger recent trend, with a 1 day share price return of 2.74% and a year to date share price return of 14.78%, even though the 1 year total shareholder return is slightly negative at 1.10%...
